bug.author: zhaoyu0810
bug.summary: vocab.set_vector throws for oov word in windows 10
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>How to reproduce the behaviour</denchmark-h>
Run below code in windows 10: <denchmark-code>import spacy import numpy as np
nlp = spacy.load('en_core_web_lg') vocab = nlp.vocab vector = np.zeros(300,) vocab.set_vector('thisisoovword', vector) #throws print('completed') </denchmark-code>
Got error: <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "d:\git\test\testSet_vector.py", line 10, in <module> vocab.set_vector('thisisoovword', vector) File "vocab.pyx", line 335, in spacy.vocab.Vocab.set_vector File "vectors.pyx", line 153, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.resize TypeError: 'int' object is not iterable </denchmark-code>
The same code works well in ubuntu <denchmark-h:h2>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
Operating System: windows 10 Python Version Used: 3.6 spaCy Version Used: 2.0.0 Environment Information:

comments.comment: Could you upgrade to v2.0.12 and check again? I think the error has been fixed, which is why you're seeing it different on Ubuntu -- I think you're using a different version there.
